author: .paulharris
content: Looking at open PR's, it's probably a good time to do a beacon-apis release, so I'll have a look at the process for that...

author: .paulharris
content: we have a release version string that has like `v2.3.0 - Eth2Spec v1.1.0` in it, considering making that `v.2.4.0 - Eth2Spec Capella` - if anyone is actually about, i'll give 10-15 min for input

author: jgm
content:
"Capella" isn't a release tag for `ethereum/consensus-specs`.

I'd be inclined to wait until `1.3.0` is officially released and tag a release then.

author: .paulharris
content: i probably can, its just blocking being able to put deneb on master

author: .paulharris
content: i could make it 1.3.0 and just be leading i guess

author: jgm
content: Only if you can trust that the spec isn't going to change.  And you know what'll happen if you mark it like this, don't you? ðŸ™‚

author: .paulharris
content: everything is inter-related blocking, something has to give

author: .paulharris
content: i guess all i can do is put up this version pr and wait until something happens

author: jgm
content: Sure, but I'd put the APIs downstream of the spec.  I don't think that not merging deneb yet is a big issue.  You could always create a deneb branch for now, merge the individual PRs to that, and then merge deneb to master once we cut a capella release.

author: .paulharris
content: its alreayd in an eip branch that i have a pr to fix, and i'll have to start doing merges to that soon if its not resolved... causing a bit of a mess

author: .paulharris
content: all good i'll put up a PR and wait on eth2spec

author: .paulharris
content: This was going to be my easy win for the day :/ But you're right, we should wait.
